author: Parvathi Menon
text:
Wax museum to spend £50 million in the next 10 years on India

Madame Tussauds, the hugely popular waxworks attraction headquartered here, is planning to open a branch in New Delhi to coincide with the 70{+t}{+h}year of India’s independence in 2017.

The attraction, which has recently decided to add Prime Minister Narendra Modi to its collection of wax celebrities, will spend £50 million in the next 10 years on India, according to Alex Cameron, marketing manager for Madame Tussauds.

“Madame Tussauds Delhi is planned to be the first Merlin attraction to open in India, and the aim is to coincide its opening with next year’s Independence celebrations,” Mr. Cameron told The Hindu .

Tussauds houses 20 such attractions across the world, all different from each other as they are tailored to the local market for a “host city vibe.”

Tussauds invited Mr. Modi since he was “one of the most requested politicians” by guests at the attraction in 2015, Mr. Cameron said. .

A wax figure takes four months to create and costs £1,50,000 each. Four wax images of Mr. Modi have been created which are to be installed in London, Singapore, Hong Kong and Bangkok.

In London, Mr. Modi’s wax statue will be displayed in the world leaders section.
title: Madame Tussauds to open in Delhi in 2017
